paragraph.paragraph:
In all flat views (
../../80_formatters/20_feature_formatters/10_flat_format.xml feature flat view and
../../80_formatters/10_class_formatters/15_flat_format.xml class flat view ), a margin is displayed on the left of the editor.
00_introduction.xml Breakpoints are there symbolized as circles, of a different appearance depending on their state: enabled (
../../../../../images/eiffelstudio/icons/12x12/bp_enabled_icon.png ), disabled (
../../../../../images/eiffelstudio/icons/12x12/bp_disabled_icon.png ) or not set (
../../../../../images/eiffelstudio/icons/12x12/bp_slot_icon.png ). A small question mark in the circle (
../../../../../images/eiffelstudio/icons/12x12/bp_enabled_conditional_icon.png ,
../../../../../images/eiffelstudio/icons/12x12/bp_disabled_conditional_icon.png )indicates
40_conditional_breakpoints.xml conditional breakpoints .
Right-clicking on any breakpoint pops up a context menu:

Clicking one of the three first entries of the context menu changes the state of the breakpoint that was right-clicked. The last entry ( Run to breakpoint) launches the debugged application so that it will stop as soon as the selected breakpoint is encountered, as if the breakpoint had been enabled.
